revised_title: Atomic Effects on Beta-Decay: Theory and Calculations
tldr: The authors discuss the atomic effects on beta-decay, focusing on the role of atomic electrons in the decay process. They present a theoretical framework for calculating these effects and apply it to the decay of a multielectron system, particularly low-energy decays. The study aims to understand the impact of atomic and chemical environments on the decay process and its implications for the half-life of isotopes.
